revised_title: Inositol and Other Substances in Boar Seminal Vesicle Secretion
tldr: The author's study discovered that the seminal vesicle secretion of the boar contains a high concentration of inositol, which exceeds the amounts found in any other plant or animal material. The fluid also contains other substances like fructose, ergothioneine, and potassium citrate. Inositol and citrate play a role in maintaining osmotic pressure in the seminal vesicle secretion and semen of the boar. The study provides information on the chemical composition of the vesicular secretion, including the presence of various carbohydrates, amino-sugars, proteins, and minerals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
